pullRequest.title: Do not allow tutors to override their own assessments if there is a complaint
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I implemented the changes with good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes

Motivation and Context
Fixes #1922
Edit: We want to allow the tutor to still see the complaint. However, he/she should not obtain the lock or be able to override the result.
Description

 Remove transactional & refactor getAllModelingSubmissionsByTutorForExercise
 Remove transactional & refactor getAllTextSubmissionsByTutorForExercise
 Remove transactional & refactor getAllFileUploadSubmissionsByTutorForExercise
 Delete obsolete DB call from ResultRepository and move to SubmissionRepository
 Add a text which lets the tutor know why he cannot override the assessment.
 Make all input elements readOnly, if the tutors assessment has a complaint

Steps for Testing

Create an exam
participate and submit it as a student
Assess an exercise as a tutor
Make a complaint about the assessment as a student
As the tutor navigate back to tutor dashboard: You should still see the submission on under your assessed submissions. But you should not be able to obtain the lock and override the assessment. Furthermore, all input fields should be read-only. Caution: Instructors are always allowed to override
Log in as a different tutor, you should see the submission in your complaints table of the tutor exercise dashboard. You should be able to handle the complaint. The submissions stays in the complaints table also after the complaint has been handled.

Screenshots

commit.message: do not fetch submissions with results which have complains

Remove transactional & refactor getSubmissionsByTutorForExercise
For all exercise types to filter out results with complaints
Also delete old method from ResultRepository and move to SubmissionRepository

Update TextSubmissionService.java

Remove transactional
Merge branch 'develop' into bugfix/hide-your-assessments-with-complains
Merge branch 'develop' into bugfix/hide-your-assessments-with-complains
allow results with complaints to be listed in the tutor dashboard
Do not allow tutors to override results if there is a complaint for their assessment
Merge branch 'develop' into bugfix/hide-your-assessments-with-complains
Lock the input fields in case the user cannot override
lock general input elements if readOnly mode
lock input elements for text submissions
hide text submissions inputs if read only
do not allow tutor to override modeling submissions if  there is a complaint
do not allow overriding if assessment has complaint
Merge branch 'bugfix/hide-your-assessments-with-complains' of github.com:ls1intum/Artemis into bugfix/hide-your-assessments-with-complains

decouple canOverride from readonly attributes, as complain evaluationg tutors should not override the result but rather evaluate the complaint. However
readonly should only apply for the original tutor, when there is a complaint for his assessment
canOverride follows the old rules (instructor | assessment on time | is Assesor) AND it must not have a complaint
update edge case header text display
Let the tutor know if the complaint has already been handled.
It should never be read only for instructors

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    // Retrieve all submissions assessed by the tutor and filter out ones which contain complaints

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -17,15 +17,39 @@

Assessment locked by: otherUser + There is a complaint for this assessment. Another tutor must respond. + + + The complaint about your assessment has been resolved. + + Original Assessor: otherUser - +

nodes.bodyText: Why do we need the else case here? I don't think we should award everyone with 'ROLE_INSTRUCTOR' these rights in this case.
I also saw this code duplicated somewhere else. Maybe we could create a super class for all exercise type assessment components and define this in there.
This appears multiple times. Would be better if this is defined in one place.

commit.message: implement code review suggestions
